content: eht revollup aniger the regina pullover construction overview the regina pullover is a simple off-shoulder sweater worked in a modified raglan construction first the yoke is cast on using a provisional cast-on and the body and sleeves are worked top-down in the round additionally the sleeves are worked with decreases for a slightly tapered fit the collar is then picked up from the provisional cast-on and worked in 1x1 rib optional shaping for the body is also included for a more fitted look elastic thread can also be added with a crochet slip_stitch to further secure the collar the pattern starts on page 3 for all questions and pattern support please email support@emknits co yarn materials 910 970 1040 1100 1150 1310 1430 1540 1660 us size 7 4 5 mm crochet hook 1780 yards 832 887 951 1006 1052 1198 1308 elastic thread optional 1408 1518 1628 meters of a worsted weight yarn for scrap yarn for provisional cast-on without waist shaping you will need approximately 30- sewing needle optional 50 yards 27-35 meters less if you choose to work waist stitch markers shaping tapestry needle for this garment i recommend using a wool wool- blend or a fiber with some elasticity plant based yarns techniques like 100% cotton will not retain its shape once adding elastic thread to a collar optional stretched which is needed to ensure the pullover stays up backwards loop cast-on on your shoulders especially for the collar increasing and decreasing italian bind-off provisional cast-on needles us size 8 5 mm circular needles 24 32 or 40 in 60 80 or 100 cm terms and abbreviations k = knit us size 7 4 5 mm circular needles 24 32 or 40 in 60 p = purl 80 or 100 cm st = stitch es rs = right side this is only the recommended size please use whatever ws = wrong side size necessary to achieve gauge sm = stitch marker pm = place marker bor / hor = beginning of round / halfway of round gauge m1r / m1l = make one right / make one left 18 stitches x 24 row on 4x4 in 10x10 cm using us k2tog / ssk = knit two together / slip slip knit size 8 5 mm needles in stockinette in the round tbl = through the back loop blocked by = break yarn working needle = needle that is knitting stitches 22 stitches x 24 row on 4x4 in 10 x 10 cm using us resting needle = needle that is holding stitches size 7 4 5 mm needles in 1x1 rib in the round blocked and unstretched terms of use this pattern is for personal and non-commercial use 15 stitches x 24 row on 4x4 in 10 x 10 cm using us only you may not copy redistribute sell or share size 7 4 5 mm needles in 1x1 rib in the round blocked this pattern if you sell garments made from this and fully stretched
